alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 3:16PM MST until June 26 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Fire scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 310 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Fire scar earlier today. Light to moderate rain continues over Wupatki Trails and Timberline. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bonito Campground At Sunset Crater, Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Timberline, Sunset Crater Visitors Center and Lockett Meadow Campground. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 426 and 436. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Deadman Wash and Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Fire scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
